sub_topic: Solving systems of linear equations using Gaussian elimination
message_1:
Solve the following system of linear equations using Gaussian Elimination:

3x + 4y = 20

2x + 5y = 25

Show all the steps involved in the process of elimination and write the solution set as an ordered pair (x, y).
message_2:
To solve the system of linear equations using Gaussian Elimination, we first write the augmented matrix:

| 3  4 | 20 |
| 2  5 | 25 |

Step 1: We want to get a 1 in the top-left corner, so we'll divide the first row by 3:

| 1  4/3 | 20/3 |
| 2  5   | 25   |

Step 2: Now we want to eliminate the 2 in the second row, first column. To do this, we'll subtract 2 times the first row from the second row:

(2nd row) - 2*(1st row) = | 0  3 | 5 |

Now our matrix looks like this:

| 1  4/3 | 20/3 |
| 0  3   | 5    |

Step 3: Next, we want to get a 1 in the second row, second column. We'll divide the second row by 3:

| 1  4/3 | 20/3 |
| 0  1   | 5/3  |

Step 4: Finally, we want to eliminate the 4/3 in the first row, second column. To do this, we'll subtract 4/3 times the second row from the first row:

(1st row) - (4/3)*(2nd row) = | 1  0 | 4 |

Now our matrix looks like this:

| 1  0 | 4   |
| 0  1 | 5/3 |

From this matrix, we can read off the solution as an ordered pair (x, y) = (4, 5/3).
